Is there a way that I can have a piece of syntax that continues until it sees an indentation level equal to the start? of the macro? For example, something like
syntax "foobar" term : term where the term can go across multiple lines and only stops once it detects it is on the same indentation level as foo such as

foobar do
   let x := 5
   let y := 6
something_else

the term would consist of the do block with the assignments, but not something_else
I'm really new to metaprogramming so any help would be greatly appreciated?

Edit: Haha wait it does this by default! My syntax was wrong at first!
Zach Battleman has marked this topic as resolved.
